note.p: Physician and specialist in insanity. MD, Aberdeen, 1849. Opened two private lunatic asylums in Hammersmith in 1847 and carried on a private psychiatric practice outside the asylum. Founded the Journal of Psychological Medicine and Mental Pathology in 1848. Published prolifically on psychiatric subjects. A controversial expert witness in teh courts, being one of the most extreme advocates of the non-responsibility of the insane.
